AssociateSecurityGroups.document: This API is used to associate security groups with Tencent Cloud resources in batches.
AssociateSecurityGroups.name: Associates security groups in batches

CancelDcnJob.document: This API is used to cancel DCN synchronization.
CancelDcnJob.name: Cancels DCN synchronization

CloneAccount.document: This API is used to clone an instance account.
CloneAccount.name: Clones instance account

CloseDBExtranetAccess.document: This API is used to disable public network access for a TencentDB instance, which will make the public IP address inaccessible. The `DescribeDCDBInstances` API will not return the public domain name and port information of the corresponding instance.
CloseDBExtranetAccess.name: Disables public network access

CopyAccountPrivileges.document:
This API is used to copy the permissions of a TencentDB account.
Note: accounts with the same username but different hosts are different accounts. Permissions can only be copied between accounts with the same `Readonly` attribute.
CopyAccountPrivileges.name: Copies account permissions

CreateAccount.document: This API is used to create a TencentDB account. Multiple accounts can be created for one instance. Accounts with the same username but different hosts are different accounts.
CreateAccount.name: Creates account

CreateDBInstance.document: This API is used to create a monthly subscribed TencentDB instance by passing in information such as instance specifications, database version number, validity period, and quantity.
CreateDBInstance.name: Creates a monthly subscribed instance

CreateHourDBInstance.document: This API is used to create pay-as-you-go instances.
CreateHourDBInstance.name: Creates pay-as-you-go instances

DeleteAccount.document: This API is used to delete a TencentDB account, which is uniquely identified by username and host.
DeleteAccount.name: Deletes account

DescribeAccountPrivileges.document:
This API is used to query the permissions of a TencentDB account.
Note: Accounts with the same username but different hosts are different accounts.
DescribeAccountPrivileges.name: Queries account permissions

DescribeAccounts.document: This API is used to query the list of accounts of a specified TencentDB instance.
DescribeAccounts.name: Queries account list

DescribeDBInstances.document:
This API is used to query the TencentDB instance list. It supports filtering instances by project ID, instance ID, private address, and instance name.
If no filter is specified, 20 instances will be returned by default. Up to 100 instances can be returned for a single request.
DescribeDBInstances.name: Queries instance list

DescribeDBLogFiles.document: This API is used to get the list of various logs of a database, including cold backups, binlogs, errlogs, and slowlogs.
DescribeDBLogFiles.name: Gets log list

DescribeDBParameters.document: This API is used to get the current parameter settings of a database.
DescribeDBParameters.name: Views database parameters

DescribeDBSecurityGroups.document: This API is used to query the security group details of an instance.
DescribeDBSecurityGroups.name: Queries the security group details of an instance

DescribeDBSlowLogs.document: This API is used to query the list of slow query logs.
DescribeDBSlowLogs.name: Queries slow query log list

DescribeDatabaseObjects.document: This API is used to query the list of database objects in a TencentDB instance, including tables, stored procedures, views, and functions.
DescribeDatabaseObjects.name: Queries database object list

DescribeDatabaseTable.document: This API is used to query the table information of a TencentDB instance.
DescribeDatabaseTable.name: Queries table information

DescribeDatabases.document: This API is used to query the database list of a TencentDB instance.
DescribeDatabases.name: Queries database list

DescribeDcnDetail.document: This API is used to query the disaster recovery details of an instance.
DescribeDcnDetail.name: Queries the disaster recovery details of an instance

DescribeFileDownloadUrl.document: This API is used to get the download URL of a specific backup or log file of a database.
DescribeFileDownloadUrl.name: Gets the backup/log download URL

DescribeInstanceNodeInfo.document: This API is used to query the information of primary and replica nodes of an instance.
DescribeInstanceNodeInfo.name: Queries instance node information

DescribeLogFileRetentionPeriod.document: This API is used to view the backup log retention days.
DescribeLogFileRetentionPeriod.name: Views backup log retention days

DescribeOrders.document: This API is used to query TencentDB order information. You can pass in an order ID to query the TencentDB instance associated with the order and the corresponding task process ID.
DescribeOrders.name: Queries order information

DescribePrice.document: This API is used to query the instance price before you purchase it.
DescribePrice.name: Queries the purchase price of an instance

DescribeProjectSecurityGroups.document: This API is used to query the security group details of a project.
DescribeProjectSecurityGroups.name: Queries the security group details of a project

DestroyDBInstance.document: This API is used to terminate an isolated monthly subscribed instance.
DestroyDBInstance.name: Terminates an isolated monthly subscribed instance

DestroyHourDBInstance.document: This API is used to terminate a pay-as-you-go instance.
DestroyHourDBInstance.name: Terminates a pay-as-you-go instance

DisassociateSecurityGroups.document: This API is used to unassociate security groups from instances in batches.
DisassociateSecurityGroups.name: Unassociates security groups in batches

GrantAccountPrivileges.document:
This API is used to grant permissions to a TencentDB account.
Note: accounts with the same username but different hosts are different accounts.
GrantAccountPrivileges.name: Sets account permissions

IsolateDBInstance.document: This API is used to isolate a monthly subscribed TencentDB instance, which will no longer be accessible via IP and port. The isolated instance can be started up in the recycle bin. If it is isolated due to overdue payments, top up your account as soon as possible.
IsolateDBInstance.name: Isolates a monthly subscribed TencentDB instance

IsolateDedicatedDBInstance.document: This API is used to isolate a dedicated TencentDB instance.
IsolateDedicatedDBInstance.name: Isolates a dedicated TencentDB instance

KillSession.document: This API is used to kill the specified session.
KillSession.name: Kills the specified session.

ModifyAccountDescription.document:
This API is used to modify the remarks of a TencentDB account.
Note: accounts with the same username but different hosts are different accounts.
ModifyAccountDescription.name: Modifies account remarks

ModifyAccountPrivileges.document:
This API is used to modify the permissions of a TencentDB instance account.

**Notes**
- Only the SELECT permission (that is, set the permission parameter to `["SELECT"]`) of the system database `mysql` can be granted.
- An error will be reported if read-write permissions are granted to a read-only account.
- If the parameter of permissions at a level is left empty, no change will be made to the permissions at the level that have been granted. To clear granted permissions at a level, set `GlobalPrivileges.N` or `Privileges` to an empty array.
ModifyAccountPrivileges.name: Modifies the permissions of a TencentDB instance account

ModifyDBInstancesProject.document: This API is used to modify the project to which TencentDB instances belong.
ModifyDBInstancesProject.name: Modifies the project to which instances belong

ModifyDBParameters.document: This API is used to modify database parameters.
ModifyDBParameters.name: Modifies database parameters

ModifyDBSyncMode.document: This API is used to modify the sync mode of a TencentDB instance.
ModifyDBSyncMode.name: Modifies sync mode

ModifyInstanceNetwork.document: This API is used to modify instance network.
ModifyInstanceNetwork.name: Modifies instance network

ModifyInstanceVip.document: This API is used to modify instance VIP.
ModifyInstanceVip.name: Modifies instance VIP

ModifyInstanceVport.document: This API is used to modify instance Vport.
ModifyInstanceVport.name: Modifies instance Vport

ModifySyncTaskAttribute.document: This API is used to modify sync task attributes (currently, only the task name can be modified).
ModifySyncTaskAttribute.name: Modifies sync task attributes

ResetAccountPassword.document:
This API is used to reset the password of a TencentDB account.
Note: accounts with the same username but different hosts are different accounts.
ResetAccountPassword.name: Resets account password

TerminateDedicatedDBInstance.document: This API is used to terminate the isolated dedicated TencentDB instance.
TerminateDedicatedDBInstance.name: Terminates the dedicated TencentDB instance

members.document: Instance ID, which is in the format of `tdsql-ow728lmc` and can be obtained through the `DescribeDBInstances` API.
members.name: InstanceId

members.document: Login username, which can contain 1-32 letters, digits, underscores, and hyphens.
members.name: UserName

members.document: Host that can be logged in to, which is in the same format as the host of the MySQL account and supports wildcards, such as %, 10.%, and 10.20.%.
members.name: Host

members.document: Account password. It must contain 8-32 characters in all of the following four types: lowercase letters, uppercase letters, digits, and symbols (()~!@#$%^&*-+=_|{}[]:<>,.?/), and cannot start with a slash (/).
members.name: Password

members.document: Whether to create a read-only account. 0: no; 1: for the account's SQL requests, the secondary will be used first, and if it is unavailable, the primary will be used; 2: the secondary will be used first, and if it is unavailable, the operation will fail.
members.name: ReadOnly

members.document: Account remarks, which can contain 0-256 letters, digits, and common symbols.
members.name: Description

members.document: Determines whether the secondary is unavailable based on the passed-in time
members.name: DelayThresh

members.document: Whether to specify a replica server for read-only account. Valid values: `0` (No replica server is specified, which means that the proxy will select another available replica server to keep connection with the client if the current replica server doesn’t meet the requirement). `1` (The replica server is specified, which means that the connection will be disconnected if the specified replica server doesn’t meet the requirement.)
members.name: SlaveConst

members.document: Maximum number of connections. If left empty or `0` is passed in, the connections will be unlimited. This parameter configuration is not supported for kernel version 10.1.
members.name: MaxUserConnections

members.document: Instance ID, which is passed through from the input parameters.
members.name: InstanceId

members.document: Username, which is passed through from the input parameters.
members.name: UserName

members.document: Host allowed for access, which is passed through from the input parameters.
members.name: Host

members.document: Passed through from the input parameters.
members.name: ReadOnly

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: AZs to deploy instance nodes. You can specify up to two AZs (one as primary AZ and another as replica AZ). When the shard specification is 1-primary-2-replica, the primary and one of the replicas are deployed in the primary AZ.
members.name: Zones

members.document:
Number of nodes, which can be obtained 
 by querying the instance specification through the `DescribeDBInstanceSpecs` API.
members.name: NodeCount

members.document:
Memory size in GB, which can be obtained 
 by querying the instance specification through the `DescribeDBInstanceSpecs` API.
members.name: Memory

members.document:
Storage capacity in GB. The maximum and minimum storage space can be obtained 
 by querying instance specification through the `DescribeDBInstanceSpecs` API.
members.name: Storage

members.document: Validity period in months
members.name: Period

members.document: The number of instances to be purchased. Only one instance is queried for price by default.
members.name: Count

members.document: Whether to automatically use vouchers. This option is disabled by default.
members.name: AutoVoucher

members.document: Voucher ID list. Currently, you can specify only one voucher.
members.name: VoucherIds

members.document: VPC ID. If this parameter is not passed in, the instance will be created on the classic network.
members.name: VpcId

members.document: VPC subnet ID, which is required when `VpcId` is specified.
members.name: SubnetId

members.document: Project ID, which can be obtained through the `DescribeProjects` API. If this parameter is not passed in, the instance will be associated with the default project.
members.name: ProjectId

members.document: Database engine version. Valid values: `8.0.18`, `10.1.9`, `5.7.17`. Default value: `5.7.17`.
members.name: DbVersionId

members.document: Name of the instance, which can be customized.
members.name: InstanceName

members.document: List of security group IDs
members.name: SecurityGroupIds

members.document: Auto-renewal flag. Valid values: `1` (auto-renewal), `2` (no renewal upon expiration).
members.name: AutoRenewFlag

members.document: Whether IPv6 is supported.
members.name: Ipv6Flag

members.document: Array of tag key-value pairs
members.name: ResourceTags

members.document: List of parameters. Valid values: `character_set_server` (character set; required); `lower_case_table_names` (table name case sensitivity; required; `0`: case-sensitive; `1`: case-insensitive); `innodb_page_size` (InnoDB data page size; default size: 16 KB); `sync_mode` (sync mode; `0`: async; `1`: strong sync; `2`: downgradable strong sync; default value: `2`).
members.name: InitParams

members.document: DCN source region
members.name: DcnRegion

members.document: DCN source instance ID
members.name: DcnInstanceId

members.document:
Order ID, which is used for calling the `DescribeOrders` API.
 The parameter can be used to either query order details or call the user account APIs to make another payment when this payment fails.
members.name: DealName

members.document:
IDs of the instances you have purchased in this order. If no instance IDs are returned, you can query them with the `DescribeOrders` API. You can also use the `DescribeDBInstances` API to check whether an instance has been created successfully.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: InstanceIds

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: AZs to deploy instance nodes. You can specify up to two AZs.
members.name: Zones

members.document: Number of nodes.
members.name: NodeCount

members.document: Memory size in GB.
members.name: Memory

members.document: Storage size in GB.
members.name: Storage

members.document: Number of instances to purchase.
members.name: Count

members.document: Project ID. If this parameter is not passed in, the default project will be used.
members.name: ProjectId

members.document: Unique ID of the network. If this parameter is not passed in, the classic network will be used.
members.name: VpcId

members.document: Unique ID of the subnet. If `VpcId` is specified, this parameter is required.
members.name: SubnetId

members.document:
Database engine version. Valid values: 10.0.10, 10.1.9, 5.7.17.
If this parameter is left empty, `10.1.9` will be used.
members.name: DbVersionId

members.document: Custom name of the instance.
members.name: InstanceName

members.document: Whether IPv6 is supported.
members.name: Ipv6Flag

members.document: Array of tag key-value pairs.
members.name: ResourceTags

members.document: If you create a disaster recovery instance, you need to use this parameter to specify the region of the associated primary instance so that the disaster recovery instance can sync data with the primary instance over the Data Communication Network (DCN).
members.name: DcnRegion

members.document: If you create a disaster recovery instance, you need to use this parameter to specify the ID of the associated primary instance so that the disaster recovery instance can sync data with the primary instance over the Data Communication Network (DCN).
members.name: DcnInstanceId
InitParams

members.document: ID of the instance whose backup data will be rolled back to the new instance you create.
members.name: RollbackInstanceId

members.document: Rollback time.
members.name: RollbackTime

members.document:
Order ID, which is used for calling the `DescribeOrders` API.
 The parameter can be used to either query order details or call the user account APIs to make another payment when this payment fails.
members.name: DealName

members.document:
IDs of the instances you have purchased in this order. If no instance IDs are returned, you can query them with the `DescribeOrders` API. You can also use the `DescribeDBInstances` API to check whether an instance has been created successfully.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: InstanceIds

members.document:
Async task ID, which can be used in the [DescribeFlow](https://www.tencentcloud.com/document/product/237/16177) API to query the async task result.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: FlowId

members.name: RequestId

members.document: Username

members.document: Host from which a user can log in (corresponding to the `host` field for a MySQL user; a user is uniquely identified by username and host; this parameter is in IP format and ends with % for IP range; % can be entered; if this parameter is left empty, % will be used by default).
members.name: Host

members.document: User remarks

members.name: UpdateTime

members.document: Read-only flag. 0: no; 1: for the account's SQL requests, the replica will be used first, and if it is unavailable, the primary will be used; 2: the replica will be used first, and if it is unavailable, the operation will fail.
members.name: ReadOnly

members.document:
This field is meaningful for read-only accounts, indicating that a replica should be selected if its delay from the primary is less than this value.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: DelayThresh

members.document: Whether to specify a replica server for read-only account. Valid values: `0` (No replica server is specified, which means that the proxy will select another available replica server to keep connection with the client if the current replica server doesn’t meet the requirement). `1` (The replica server is specified, which means that the connection will be disconnected if the specified replica server doesn’t meet the requirement.)

members.name: PeriodEndTime

members.document: Instance type. Valid values: `1` (dedicated primary instance), `2` (non-dedicated primary instance), `3` (non-dedicated disaster recovery instance), `4` (dedicated disaster recovery instance)
members.name: InstanceType

members.document:
Configuration information of DCN replication. This field is null for a primary instance.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: ReplicaConfig

members.document:
DCN replication status. This field is null for the primary instance.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.

members.document: Type. Valid values: table, view, proc, func, \*. If `DbName` is a specific database name and `Type` is `\*`, the permissions of the database will be queried (i.e., `db.\*`), in which case the `Object` parameter will be ignored.
members.name: Type

members.document: Type name. For example, if `Type` is `table`, `Object` indicates a specific table name; if both `DbName` and `Type` are specific names, it indicates a specific object name and cannot be `\*` or empty.
members.name: Object

members.document: If `Type` is `table` and `ColName` is `\*`, the permissions of the table will be queried; if `ColName` is a specific field name, the permissions of the corresponding field will be queried.

members.name: Privileges

members.document: Instance ID, which is in the format of `tdsql-ow728lmc` and can be obtained through the `DescribeDBInstances` API.
members.name: InstanceId

members.document: Login username.
members.name: UserName

members.document: Access host allowed for user. An account is uniquely identified by username and host.
members.name: Host

members.document: Database name. `\*` indicates that global permissions will be set (i.e., `\*.\*`), in which case the `Type` and `Object ` parameters will be ignored. If `DbName` is not `\*`, the input parameter `Type` is required.
members.name: DbName

members.document:
Global permission. Valid values: `SELECT`, `INSERT`, `UPDATE`, `DELETE`, `CREATE`, `DROP`, `REFERENCES`, `INDEX`, `ALTER`, `CREATE TEMPORARY TABLES`, `LOCK TABLES`, `EXECUTE`, `CREATE VIEW`, `SHOW VIEW`, `CREATE ROUTINE`, `ALTER ROUTINE`, `EVENT`, `TRIGGER`, `SHOW DATABASES`, `REPLICATION CLIENT`, `REPLICATION SLAVE`. 
Database permission. Valid values: `SELECT`, `INSERT`, `UPDATE`, `DELETE`, `CREATE`, `DROP`, `REFERENCES`, `INDEX`, `ALTER`, `CREATE TEMPORARY TABLES`, `LOCK TABLES`, `EXECUTE`, `CREATE VIEW`, `SHOW VIEW`, `CREATE ROUTINE`, `ALTER ROUTINE`, `EVENT`, `TRIGGER`. 
Table/View permission. Valid values: `SELECT`, `INSERT`, `UPDATE`, `DELETE`, `CREATE`, `DROP`, `REFERENCES`, `INDEX`, `ALTER`, `CREATE VIEW`, `SHOW VIEW`, `TRIGGER`. 
Stored procedure/function permission. Valid values: `ALTER ROUTINE`, `EXECUTE`. 
Field permission. Valid values: `INSERT`, `REFERENCES`, `SELECT`, `UPDATE`.
members.name: Privileges

members.document: Type. Valid values: table, view, proc, func, \*. If `DbName` is a specific database name and `Type` is `\*`, the permissions of the database will be set (i.e., `db.\*`), in which case the `Object` parameter will be ignored
members.name: Type

members.document: Type name. For example, if `Type` is `table`, `Object` indicates a specific table name; if both `DbName` and `Type` are specific names, it indicates a specific object name and cannot be `\*` or empty
members.name: Object

members.document: If `Type` is `table` and `ColName` is `\*`, the permissions will be granted to the table; if `ColName` is a specific field name, the permissions will be granted to the field
members.name: ColName

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Instance ID in the format of `tdsql-dasjkhd`. It is the same as the instance ID displayed on the TencentDB console. You can use the `DescribeDBInstances` API to query the ID, which is the value of the `InstanceId` output parameter.
members.name: InstanceIds

members.name: FailedInstanceIds

members.name: Description

members.name: RequestId

members.document: Instance ID in the format of tdsql-c1nl9rpv. It is the same as the instance ID displayed in the TencentDB console.
members.name: InstanceId

members.document: Database account, including username and host address.
members.name: Accounts

members.document:
Global permission. Valid values of `GlobalPrivileges`: `"SELECT"`, `"INSERT"`, `"UPDATE"`, `"DELETE"`, `"CREATE"`, `"PROCESS"`, `"DROP"`, `"REFERENCES"`, `"INDEX"`, `"ALTER"`, `"SHOW DATABASES"`, `"CREATE TEMPORARY TABLES"`, `"LOCK TABLES"`, `"EXECUTE"`, `"CREATE VIEW"`, `"SHOW VIEW"`, `"CREATE ROUTINE"`, `"ALTER ROUTINE"`, `"EVENT"`, `"TRIGGER"`.
Note: if the parameter is left empty, no change will be made to the granted global permissions. To clear the granted global permissions, set the parameter to an empty array.
members.name: GlobalPrivileges

members.document:
Database permission. Valid values of `Privileges`: `"SELECT"`, `"INSERT"`, `"UPDATE"`, `"DELETE"`, `"CREATE"`, `"DROP"`, `"REFERENCES"`, `"INDEX"`, `"ALTER"`, `"CREATE TEMPORARY TABLES"`, `"LOCK TABLES"`, `"EXECUTE"`, `"CREATE VIEW"`, `"SHOW VIEW"`, `"CREATE ROUTINE"`, `"ALTER ROUTINE"`, `"EVENT"`, `"TRIGGER"`.
Note: if the parameter is left empty, no change will be made to the granted database permissions. To clear the granted database permissions, set `Privileges` to an empty array.
members.name: DatabasePrivileges

members.document:
Database table permission. Valid values of `Privileges`: `SELECT`, `INSERT`, `UPDATE`, `DELETE`, `CREATE`, `DROP`, `REFERENCES`, `INDEX`, `ALTER`, `CREATE VIEW`, `SHOW VIEW`, `TRIGGER`.
Note: if the parameter is not passed in, no change will be made to the granted table permissions. To clear the granted table permissions, set `Privileges` to an empty array.
members.name: TablePrivileges

members.document:
Column permission. Valid values of `Privileges`: `"SELECT"`, `"INSERT"`, `"UPDATE"`, `"REFERENCES"`.
Note: if the parameter is left empty, no change will be made to the granted column permissions. To clear the granted column permissions, set `Privileges` to an empty array.
members.name: ColumnPrivileges

members.document:
Database view permission. Valid values of `Privileges`: `SELECT`, `INSERT`, `UPDATE`, `DELETE`, `CREATE`, `DROP`, `REFERENCES`, `INDEX`, `ALTER`, `CREATE VIEW`, `SHOW VIEW`, `TRIGGER`.
Note: if the parameter is not passed in, no change will be made to the granted view permissions. To clear the granted view permissions, set `Privileges` to an empty array.
members.name: ViewPrivileges

members.document:
Database function permissions. Valid values of `Privileges`: `ALTER ROUTINE`, `EXECUTE`.
Note: if the parameter is not passed in, no change will be made to the granted function permissions. To clear the granted function permissions, set `Privileges` to an empty array.
members.name: FunctionPrivileges

members.document:
Database stored procedure permission. Valid values of `Privileges`: `ALTER ROUTINE`, `EXECUTE`.
Note: if the parameter is not passed in, no change will be made to the granted stored procedure permissions. To clear the granted stored procedure permissions, set `Privileges` to an empty array.
members.name: ProcedurePrivileges

members.document: VIP retention period in hours. Value range: 0-168. Default value: `24`. `0` indicates that the VIP will be released immediately, but there will be 1-minute delay.
members.name: VipReleaseDelay

members.name: RequestId

members.document: IDs of tasks for which to modify the attributes. The IDs can be obtained by the return value of the `DescribeSyncTasks` API. Up to 100 tasks can be operated at a time.
members.name: TaskIds

Range when constraint type is `section`

members.name: String

members.name: Value

Whether restart is required. false: no;
true: yes.
